prob_desc_description: You are standing at the point $$$0$$$ on a coordinate line. Your goal is to reach the point $$$n$$$. In one minute, you can move by $$$2$$$ or by $$$3$$$ to the left or to the right (i. e., if your current coordinate is $$$x$$$, it can become $$$x-3$$$, $$$x-2$$$, $$$x+2$$$ or $$$x+3$$$). Note that the new coordinate can become negative.Your task is to find the minimum number of minutes required to get from the point $$$0$$$ to the point $$$n$$$.You have to answer $$$t$$$ independent test cases.
prob_desc_output_spec: For each test case, print one integer — the minimum number of minutes required to get from the point $$$0$$$ to the point $$$n$$$ for the corresponding test case.
prob_desc_input_spec: The first line of the input contains one integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \le t \le 10^4$$$) — the number of test cases. Then $$$t$$$ lines describing the test cases follow. The $$$i$$$-th of these lines contains one integer $$$n$$$ ($$$1 \le n \le 10^9$$$) — the goal of the $$$i$$$-th test case.
source_code:
# Coded By Block_Cipher

import math
import os
import random
import re
import sys
from math import gcd
from math import sqrt
from collections import Counter

for _ in range(int(input())):
	n = int(input())
	tw = n//2
	th = n//3


	if n==1:
		print(2)
	elif n==2 or n==3:
		print(1)
	else:
		if n%3==0:
			print(th)
		else:
			print(th+1)
